title: Rusty J Novotny, MD
author: Esther Enumclaw; Washington
description: Rusty J Novotny, MD, Director, Epilepsy, Professor, Neurology and Pediatrics
cleaned_text: Rusty J Novotny, MD [Neurosciences Center](https://www.seattlechildrens.org/clinics/neurosciences/), [Neurology](https://www.seattlechildrens.org/clinics/neurosciences/), [Epilepsy Program](https://www.seattlechildrens.org/clinics/neurosciences/services/epilepsy-program/) On Title: Director, Epilepsy Academic Title: Professor, Neurology and Pediatrics Foundation Title: Alvord, Gerlich and Rhodes Family Endowed Chair in Pediatric Epilepsy Research Center: [Center for Integrative Brain Research](https://www.seattlechildrens.org/research/centers-programs/integrative-brain-research/) "I was first attracted to neuroscience as an undergraduate and have been fascinated ever since. I love communicating with patients and families to help them understand the complexities and wonders of the brain. I am also amazed by my colleagues both within my program and throughout the hospital. My focus is on identifying new tools that allow us to safely investigate the brain these tools have been essential to our understanding of neurological disorders in children and help us provide better treatments. I am profoundly grateful to be a pediatric specialist at Seattle Children's." - - I was diagnosed with epilepsy when I was about 11. I had never heard of it before and had no idea what it was. When I first had it I didn't know how to cope with it. After working with him for a while, I decided to start medication. He has helped me and my family through my entire journey through epilepsy - all of my different tests, working with my medication, helping through a relapse and now I can say that I've been over a year seizure-free. - Dr. Novotny is thorough, analytical, intelligent and compassionate. We have a child with complex needs and he thinks through every decision carefully and with thoughtfulness. He is not afraid to answer questions and does so with respect and clear information. We are very impressed with his professionalism and are very thankful we found him! - I highly recommend Dr. Novotny. He oversaw our son's brain surgery - a focal cortical resection for focal cortical dysplasia which was causing Infantile Spasms. Dr. Novotny is extremely knowledgeable about Infantile Spasms, Adreno-Cortico-Tropic Hormone (ACTH) and its potential benefits and negative side effects. If you live in the Pacific Northwest and Alaska, your best choice for a neurologist is Dr. Novotny. The quality of your child's outcome can depend greatly on having a qualified neurologist who knows what kinds of medical risks to take, when to take them, and when the negative effects of medication are outweighing the risks. I would trust Dr. Novotny with my child's life. He is very thorough, and does not overlook anything. He also does a very complete assessment, and pays attention to the parents' concerns. - Dr. Novotny and his staff have been very easy to approach about any concerns or questions I have about my daughter. He is kind, and knowledgeable, and always takes the time to sit and explain any information to you. I never feel like a question is irrelevant. - - Award Name Award Description Awarded By Award Date SEATTLE TOP DOCTOR - 2022 Seattle Magazine 2022 Seattle Top Doctor - 2019 Seattle Magazine 2019 SEATTLE'S TOP DOCTOR - 2018 Seattle Magazine 2018 SEATTLE'S TOP DOCTOR - 2017 Seattle Magazine 2017 Fellow American Epilepsy Society Dec. 2016 SEATTLE MAGAZINE TOP DOCTOR - 2016 Seattle Magazine 2016 Seattles Top Doctor 2016 Seattle Met Magazine 2016 SEATTLE MAGAZINE TOP DOCTOR - 2015 Seattle Magazine 2015 Fellow American Academy of Neurology May 2014 Seattle Magazine Top Doctor - 2012 Seattle Magazine Top Doctor - 2012 Seattle Magazine 2012 U.S. News Top Doctor U.S. News and World Report 2012 Ad-Hoc reviewer NIH Study section - NIDA NIDA Jan 1, 2009 S.
